DataElement.preferredName: Gene Mutation ACMG Clinical Significance Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The treatment or management implications for a patient's condition caused by a gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, as defined by the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG) .

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.:A nationally recognized interdisciplinary professional membership organization that represents the interests of the entire medical genetics field including clinical geneticists, clinical laboratory geneticists, and genetic counselors. The ACMG and its members engage in coordinated efforts to improve patient care, ensure optimal reimbursement for genetic service providers, establish standards of care and laboratory policy, and educate members about advances important to their practices. (https://www.acmg.net/)_A finding that has treatment or management implications for a patient's condition.

Concepts.definition: The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Property.preferredName: American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics Clinical Significance
Property.preferredDefinition: A nationally recognized interdisciplinary professional membership organization that represents the interests of the entire medical genetics field including clinical geneticists, clinical laboratory geneticists, and genetic counselors. The ACMG and its members engage in coordinated efforts to improve patient care, ensure optimal reimbursement for genetic service providers, establish standards of care and laboratory policy, and educate members about advances important to their practices. (https://www.acmg.net/)_A finding that has treatment or management implications for a patient's condition.

Concepts.longName: American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics
Concepts.definition: A nationally recognized interdisciplinary professional membership organization that represents the interests of the entire medical genetics field including clinical geneticists, clinical laboratory geneticists, and genetic counselors. The ACMG and its members engage in coordinated efforts to improve patient care, ensure optimal reimbursement for genetic service providers, establish standards of care and laboratory policy, and educate members about advances important to their practices. (https://www.acmg.net/)
A finding that has treatment or management implications for a patient's condition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 4/12/23 Created per PCDC metadata template. mr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding that has treatment or management implications for a patient's condition._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic variant that is not expected to contribute to the development of a disease, but the scientific evidence may be insufficient to prove this conclusively.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variant that is not expected to contribute to the development of a disease, but the scientific evidence may be insufficient to prove this conclusively.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic variant that is known to not contribute to the development of a disease.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variant that is known to not contribute to the development of a disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic variant that is known to directly contribute to the development of disease.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variant that is known to directly contribute to the development of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genetic variant that is known to have a high likelihood (greater than 90% certainty) to contribute to the development of a disease.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variant that is known to have a high likelihood (greater than 90% certainty) to contribute to the development of a disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that there is not enough information to support a more definitive classification of the pathogenicity of a genetic variant.

Concepts.definition: An indication that there is not enough information to support a more definitive classification of the pathogenicity of a genetic variant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

Concepts.definition: A finding that has treatment or management implications for a patient's condition.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
